Support matrix

Event Streams

See the following table for information about the latest Event Streams versions. For information about earlier versions, see the earlier version tables.

Note: Product defect fixes and security updates are only available in the latest CD version, in line with the IBM’s continuous delivery lifecycle policy (for more information, see the Event Streams support lifecycle addendum). Ensure you stay current with the installation of the latest CD update packages.

Important: If you want to set up persistent storage, Event Streams requires block storage configured to use the XFS or ext4 file system. The use of file storage (for example, NFS) is not recommended.
For example, you can use one of the following systems:

  • Kubernetes local volumes
  • Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS)
  • Rook Ceph
  • Red Hat OpenShift Container Storage
Event Streams version Operator version Operator channel Kafka version shipped CASE version Container platform Systems
11.2.1 3.2.1 v3.2 3.4.0 3.2.1 Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform versions 4.10 to 4.12, all fix levels (see support dates).

Managed OpenShift services on cloud platforms (PaaS):
- Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud
- Azure Red Hat OpenShift
- Red Hat OpenShift Service on AWS

Note: AWS ECS Fargate is not supported.

OpenShift on cloud infrastructure (IaaS):
- IBM Cloud
- Microsoft Azure
- Amazon Web Services

Kubernetes platforms that support the Red Hat Universal Base Images (UBI) containers, versions 1.21 to 1.27		 - Linux on IBM Power Systems (ppc64le)
- Linux 64-bit (x86_64) systems
- Linux on IBM z13 (s390x) or later systems

Event Endpoint Management

Note: If you want to set up persistent storage, Event Endpoint Management requires persistent volumes with the following capabilities: volumeMode: Filesystem and accessMode: ReadWriteOnce. For example, you can use Rook Ceph. For details, see Storage requirements for Event Endpoint Management.

Event Endpoint Management version Operator version Operator channel CASE version Container platform Systems
11.0.0 11.0.0 v11.0 11.0.0 Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform versions 4.10 to 4.12, all fix levels (see support dates).

Managed OpenShift services on cloud platforms (PaaS):
- Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud
- Azure Red Hat OpenShift
- Red Hat OpenShift Service on AWS

Note: AWS ECS Fargate is not supported.

OpenShift on cloud infrastructure (IaaS):
- IBM Cloud
- Microsoft Azure
- Amazon Web Services		 - Linux 64-bit (x86_64) systems

Event Processing

Note: If you want to set up persistent storage, Event Processing requires persistent volumes with the following capabilities: volumeMode: Filesystem and accessMode: ReadWriteOnce. For example, you can use Rook Ceph. For details, see Storage requirements for Event Processing.

Event Processing version Operator version Operator channel CASE version Container platform Systems
1.0.0 1.0.0 v1.0 1.0.0 Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform versions 4.10 to 4.12, all fix levels (see support dates).

Managed OpenShift services on cloud platforms (PaaS):
- Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud
- Azure Red Hat OpenShift
- Red Hat OpenShift Service on AWS

Note: AWS ECS Fargate is not supported.

OpenShift on cloud infrastructure (IaaS):
- IBM Cloud
- Microsoft Azure
- Amazon Web Services		 - Linux 64-bit (x86_64) systems

Note: If you want to set up persistent storage, IBM Operator for Apache Flink requires persistent volumes with the following capabilities: volumeMode: Filesystem and accessMode: ReadWriteMany. For example, you can use Rook Ceph. For details, see Storage requirements for Flink.

Flink version Operator version Operator channel CASE version Container platform Systems
